review_text: Originally I'd give it a 5 because I loved it. Until they put this huge up on the radar page. I understand it's free but I'm basically blind and now I can't really see it. Not happy.

This app is easy for me to see even though I have difficulty reading due to double vision and a minor tweak on the colors made me forget about my mild color vision deficiencies. The best part it's accuracy compared to the default app on my Cricket Galaxy S4. Very nicely done!

I ♡ the new AIR QUALITY INFO with MAP!! As an allergy asthma sufferer these are invaluable and the GRAPHICS are so easy to see. Being a Low Vision User your app is extremely easy to use doesn't strain my eyes and gives me so much information. You're the BEST! Thank you !

I hope those things will be fixed soon. Then I'd rate it a 10.
I love this app. I especially like the weather facts. It's a bit tricky however to navigate by touch with talkback. I still use it on a daily. Thanks

The interface loads real good and I enjoy the navigation.. weather dot com was always reallyyyylaggy and glitchy..also I love radar and Doppler and the minute by minute was good I'm partially color blind and everything was much clearer and easier than most things that are color-scale

Works well. Some minor issues with the way radar and satellite work but that's mostly from my preferences as a weather guy. Wish the color schemes were a little more color-blind friendly.

Absolutely the best Fantastic amazing app just love it .love the dark mode to save eye strain. Everything easy to understand detail wonderful well worth the radar sectioni could go on and on. But see for yourself well worth dipping your toes in the water if raining or reaching for the sky if sunny.guess you know I love it.thankyou developers for a great app.

Not friendly to old eyes just changed it and I don't like bar graphs and. B S update it still sucks go back to old format
Love the way you can see all month again! Thanks.. but I dont like hourly temperature layout... my old eyes have a hard time figuring it out..
I like the app but the red text in the notification area at top of screen is tough for these old eyes to see!
Screens give good info but are a little cluttered for my old eyes!

I particularly liked an older version of this app. The dark theme helps with visibility. Battery drain was an issue but has improved. Font is too small for my old eyes. I like minutescast even though it is often out to lunch. I still use other weather apps for wind speeds and direction and for better radar
Black background fantastic so easy on the old eyes

Problem since the update is its way to bright for someone who has light sensitive eyes. Its so white and sterile and basic. Even with my brightness all the way down its still too much. Also I use to just be able to slide to the next few screens and I was don't figuring out the weather in no time now there's way to too many places to go... doesn't flow like before. Basically I can't stand it now ans I'll probably get a different weather app something that doesn't make my eyes bleed and give me a headache.
The dark theme helps these sensitive eyes! Clean interface accurate info great on battery life lots options to get info want and need instead of forced info that may be useless.
Miss the inter active content and some items hard to see especially next 60 mins needs to be bolder for sight impaired people like me otherwise good
Nice app accurate to the tee. Easily accessible for those with sight loss.
Very poor display. Overuse of pastel colours and small fonts mean those of us with sight problems cannot read the detail. Will now uninstall

Small display when it could use the whole 4x2 area of the widget. I'm a senior with eyesight problems. Just checked I need to buy it if I want to be able to see it better. Found out that I needed to use a different widget to use the current location option...
I hate the updated app I have vision impairments and can barely see the information and changing to dark doesn't help. I am sorry I actually paid for the upgrade.

I am loving this app' and weather already was already installed' on my device' but it doesn't serve my purpose'. I dissbled it on my device and I d.loaded accuweather with even more stunning results' and I have a vision impairment' so sometimes you find everything in one setting' its all most worth paying for that's why I rated it a 5 but for me and my situation it's a five'. Thanks Accu-Weather'.
I would give it more stars if I could make the words bigger. I have severe vision problems. Please fix. I will give it more stars

I recently downloaded this from Google. I was fed up with my original weather app that came with my older Samsung. The ads for this are too big for the screen and too aggressive. If someone has vision problems as I do then this is not the app for you. If someone has severe epilepsy then this app may trigger a seizure. When I first got it I could read alerts and dismiss them. That is no longer the case. I'm hoping that these will be fixed soon. If not then it's time for a different app.
So far satisfied with service radar could be easier to read as well as writing for a person with vision problems.
After using this app for years they decided to change the font size with no option to make it larger. It is now un-usable for anyone with a visual impairment!

Please add an option for BIG font! I can't read anything but the basic temperature because everything is so SMALL!!! I'm visually impaired so I can't read that tiny print. I'm unfortunately going to have to delete this app Christina Laty
For everyone that is visually impaired this app is not compatible I wouldn't even give it one star because it is not compatible interrupt

The updated widgets are truly disappointing. Why remove the daily minimum temperature? Why remove the custom transparency setting? Why remove the 3-day forecast? Why make the font size so small? Do you hold a grudge against visually impaired people?

App is good and is detailed very well. Allows for muliple settings to personalize your viewing. Would be nice if you could increase the font size on the notification bar as its quite small in the upper left corner for us visually impaired people lol
Lots of features some buttons really wanna we clicked like the rate button and tap for full screen. Too much ads for me (visually impaired)

So far best layout/design I've tried for a large tablet. Switches between locations quickly. Comprehensive weather coverage. Suggestion: would like to receive lightning alerts when in my current location... Blind/Visually Impaired User.

Many people especially those with low vision cannot read white on black. I'm one of those people. Unfortunately there does not seem to be an option to change the theme to black on white. I have to uninstall it. Unusable. Bad call Adobe.
The fonts too small and gray text on gray background is a UX crime for the visual impaired. Good app functionality wise.
This app needs dark mode. I am gonna be blind while looking at the screen 😂

Maybe I'm an idiot and just completely missing the setting but how in the world with it being late 2019 is there no dark mode on this app. In fact it seems like they purposely realize that people most likely use the app to scroll through listings while they're laying in bed. And thought hey let's blind and them. There isn't even other shades. Why? Why you make this decision?
Great way to communicate with hosts whilst at their place. Could seriously use with a dark theme to reduce eye strain.
The app is not accessible for people with vision impairments that need to use enlarged text. You need to do better.

Third a guest gave me 5 stars in all areas but the overall rating was 4 the airbnb helpline told me there are ratings I can't see... So how to I improve what I do if I don't know?

This is especially difficult when an app developer uses pictures with words in them instead of title boxes that my software can read... Although there were lots of positive reviews for this app eventually I did manage to get it to work with the help of a relative it was extremely extremely difficult for me to use

This app is not very friendly for those with visual impairments. It does not work very well with Google screen reader talkback.

I would probably do more with Alexa if I had a written list of voice commands preferably in related groups rather than just alphabetical. Alexa is useful for anyone with sight problems or arthritis in their hands but for older people the use of apps is far from 'intuitive ' and the 'getting started' leaflet was extremely brief. We have had problems using Alexa with Sonos probably due to the frequent Sonos updates. I am using Alexa for a few specific tasks. I can't get TV info.

*a11y fail. App isn't smart enough to wait for talkback to stop talking then listen to microphone input. For that reason amazon alexa is unuseable on google devices if you're also using talkback. Uninstalled now and amazon won't be doing the necessary accessibility work to fix this problem so I recommend it not be installed on devices using talkback.
not able to work with TalkBack not able to click any link with TalkBack screen is not working.

The light control on my phone is non existent with this app. Try to read at night and it will blind you.
What a piece of crap this update is. Settings disappear. No sepia background so you blind yourself with the glaring white. Menus disappear or won't appear in the first place. Crap crsp crap.

the new version auto adjusts your brightness now every time you switch to the kindle app so users with rooted xooms can't read in the dark anymore. I'll be asking for a refund of all my unread books to save me going blind reading at night now.

I absolutely HATE the fact that you removed my ability to set the app UI to a dark theme and instead have tied it to whether or not my device UI is set to dark mode. I shouldn't have to completely change the settings of MY ENTIRE PHONE OR TABLET just to make the Kindle app not blind me every time I open it. Yeah I know I can still change the book I'm reading to be in a dark theme but you guys sure as hell have made it unpleasant to even get to the book in the first place.

You're killing my eyes guys. Why is it when I read at night you find it necessary to blast my brightness all the way up? The OS clearly is set to low but as soon as I open my books you try to blind me. Aweful

You aren't allowed to change to brightness on this app regardless of what your phone is set to or even if you've turned on the phone's blue light filter. Reading a book on this app forces you to stare at a screen so bright you feel you'll go blind and you expect it's the second coming of Christ!
Had to reload kindle and now the largest print does not work and I need it because I am going blind

I am a blind person and that makes using this app extremely difficult. A built-in read-aloud feature because not all the books on the Kindle store offer an Audible version would solve a lot of problems because text-to-speech doesn't work when trying to read my books aloud — in my case that is. Was considering subscribing to Kindle unlimited but since it's difficult to simply read books comfortably I don't think it's worth my time.

This is not blind person friendly. I can't see very well even with my glasses and there is not a way (at least I haven't found it) to zoom in far enough for me to see. You can double tap the screen but it's not big enough.

This app has come a long way. It is a pretty good app. However I think the blind accessibility still leaves a bit to be desired.I find it difficult to pause and resume the text to speech feature. The text to speech also seems to have some issues with holding my place after closing the app. All in all it seems to be a pretty solid app. There are no issues with crashing or anything like that. I am sure it works very well for those of us who are sighted. However the blind folks could use a little more attention.
Why doesn't it have software to read to blind people?

I have a lot of books in the Amazon ecosystem so this is great for me. They seem to have solved the brightness problem - it used to blind you when using it in a dark area. It's faster than before at downloads and overall very responsive. Downsides - the margins are too wide with empty space even in 'narrow' mode. Chews up battery even when not in use. Would be a 5 star app but for the battery. Samsung Galaxy Note 4 with 4.4.4
This app can now be used by blind users.
Kindle is great has a large selection. however I am legally blind and Kindle does not offer read aloud. I have to subscribe to audible and not all books are on audible

Its a really great app and all that. My only complain is that reading in the dark is an uncomfortable experience even in the Dark mode because the letters are still white and appear really bright in low light making it really a challenge to read without tilting the device awkwardly. The letters should be dim and not pure white (in dark mode) like in the google books app which I find absolutely comfortable to read in the dark. Please fix this or I'm sure I'll go blind lol
I'm going blind and have a difficult time reading so I love the large font option! I also enjoy the audio option!
Took me awhile to give in to ebooks but I love it now! Can make the page lighter or darker change the size for my blind @ss!!!
As a blind user it works well with my phone and my tablet but not with my laptop

I love this app. I am legally blind and with this app I can enlarge the font size to enable easier reading for me. I am also able to access a wide variety of books to meet all of my reading interests.
Easy to use. Love being able to change the background color. It really helps out with someone who's legally blind and still wants to read a book!

I love having my library as a 'carry on' with me regardless of device. My eye site deteriated to the point I had to submit to surgery as I was legally blind in 1 eye and the other was going. Because I could use very high contrast and blow the words up I could continue to read. Now I can read a much smaller print but I LOVE that I don't have to carry a book around anymore. I read between 1-3 books/day so carrying books is a no go for me....too much weight!
Best part is the color adjustment so you're not going blind as you read in the dark. Fast enough to not be irritating as well.
Books are too expensive. Does not do text to speech and is a slap in the face to low vision and blind users. So much for accessibility.

This a good app however this app does a pretty bad job supporting people with low vision. Kindle can be used by people who have no vision however the kindle ebooks commonly get incorrectly read by things like voice over. I believe that Amazon should do their part in trying help the legal blind community.
This app fails to cater for the needs of blind or partially sighted users. Why doesn't it have a text to speech option?

review_text: App is now completely inaccessible with the screen reader talkback on Android for the blind and visually impaired. I can browse my library but I cannot read any book once it is opened. please fix this Amazon!

Crashes occasionally. Database of books gets corrupted easily. Complicated settings without an organized all-preferences page. Fonts go from medium to extra large without any in between font sizes. Very difficult to read if you are sight impaired no high contrast mode found yet. If you are blind add the Alexa APP and ask it to read your Kindle book to you. Audible integration is fuctional but very difficult to discover if your book has been added. Text-to-speech is NOT included.

Would be 5 otherwise but needs a text-to-speech option available on the desktop app. The accessibility for Android phones like 'Talk Back' is too complicated to navigate by sighted users. Not only blind people use speech reading as an adaptation.

review_text: Need accessibility Built NY with talkback a vision assistance for blind and visually impaired people Great for those who are totally fight it where do naughty text to speech right out to them however if you're blind it is not equipped encoded properly to work with talkback that is so services found under Settings accessibility talk back for visually impaired and blind people. Amazon you can check with your appt is accessible by turn me on a emulator which shows w and show on screen. Please fix looking forward to read books from Amazon Kylie I can only do it was an iPhone and I want to do with my android.

Following a recent update the Kindle app is now accessible to the blind and visually impaired the improvement this has made to many people's lives cannot be under estimated - the freedom and ability to read books on an equal basis is something everybody deserves and Amazon have finally stepped up to the mark and made their app accessible - vi's benefit and amazon benefit through book sales - thank you it's a great job! **************************************************************** I have a Kindle Keyboard which has built in text to speech however I'm disappointed that the Android app will not read aloud using Android's TTS engine as a blind customer this is crucial for me to use it wake up Amazon it's the 21st Century!!

I loved Kindle when it first came out but I have come to hate it. I am so sick of having Audible crammed down my throat. I have developed cataracts and am waiting on surgery. I would love to use text to speech to catch up on some of the Gutenberg stuff but get nothing but offers to buy the material from Audible. Why did they do away with text to speech? My local library now has a better selection of ebooks and audiobooks for free with much easier controls.
S so excited to get started reading again after my cataract surgery now I can do that with my phone or a Kindle It's Made A Difference In My Life
There is great satisfaction in having a book in my hands but having cataracts reading on Kindle is easier.
love being able to read books on kindle. I have a cataract and reading from kindle where you can enlarge the print and have a back light is great!

I swore I'd never read a book electronically. I love the feeling of holding a book. Suddenly I became ill with chronic Lyme disease. Also had to have cataract surgery and one of the risks occurred and then follow-up surgery. My daughter bought me a kindle and almost 2years ago and after160 books - I've never looked back.

I thought that I couldn't read anymore because I have severe dry eye and reading was painful. But then I discovered that I can enlarge the text so much that it doesn't hurt my eyes and therefore I can read again! Thank goodness for technology!

I was in the middle of a graphic novel (Superman: Action Comics volume 1) when my Google Nexus 10 auto-installed the latest Kindle build. Prior to this new build graphic novels had been fun to read and even the smallest details were clear on the Nexus' excellent screen. With this latest Kindle build everything even normal sized text is blurry and causes immediate painful eye strain. Fix this Amazon and fix it fast or I won't be purchasing any more Kindle books from you. I have so far spent well over $3000 on Kindle books. Expect to lose a lot of business if this bug isn't fixed immediately.

The kindle app keeps the screen too bright. I have my tablet set to the lowest brightness and Kindle set to lowest brightness as well. However screen is too bright when the room is dark and causes eye strain. Other ereading apps that I use allow me to turn the brightness real low. (Using Nexus 7)

The app won't respect the device's brightness settings. You may choose the lowest brightness settings in order to be able to read comfortably in the dark and as soon as you run the app it will default to a very bright level which causes eye strain. The app will not show the book covers of books not purchased directly from Amazon which hurts the user experience and makes it difficult to find the books you want to read.
No screen brightness control. Runs full brightness regardless of tablet settings. Eye strain anyone?

If you get eye strain easily there's no point. Reading what's in the update theres a bug and the screen will not turn orientations for me so im stuck reading a newspaper column. Makes me slower and it hurts my eyes. There is also no night mode option like there is on the computer. Get a headache every time i use it and wish i could just delete the app but i like having my books in my back pocket unfortunately. Why are bugs so common for this app

You've really dropped the ball on this one Kindle. This 'update' has created more problems than solutions. Way to go! Yeah and thanks for dumping 'dark mode' my eye strain now will certainly thank you!!!

As a full time student it's better for me to carry around ebooks than it is to hurt my back. With the new updates I have had problem after problem. Not only is this program glitchy in the fact that it shows error cannot sync to the system but I can't read my book for class even after having to restart the program constantly. It's a waste of my time and its a pain in the behind. especially when your only book for class won't open for continual use. Then there's the God-awful screen brightness which is causing eye strain. Most of my books are on this app. Its really crappy that no matter how you turn down the brightness it is always going to burn your eyeballs - that is when the app is actually working. Kindle what are you doing? Fix this. Stop wasting our time. Also why can't we listen to books we've already purchased without having to purchase the additional audio portion of the book why do I have to pay for the same book twice?
Every time I open a book outdoors the background auto dims itself to almost black and causes eye strain if I try to read that way.

Unusable outside or in direct sunlight. There is no option to set the backlighting brightness and it defaults to the dimmest setting when outdoors making it impossible to read without inducing serious eye strain.

I just started using this app again recently and so far I am not enjoying it at all. The screen brightness is waaaaay brighter than my phone's setting for other apps and it is causing serious eye strain since I'm not reading outside. Outdoors that would be nice. I cannot find a menu option within each book to put it in dark mode for the book.
Same problems as other editions... no options for font style line and character spacing or better control over colors. Critical for low eye strain.

I love that this app synchs with my kindle however it is missing one crucial featuer for me: custom text colour. I often read in bed when I can't sleep and to avoid disturbing my partner by turning a light on I use my phone. I've set the background to black back-light to minimum but the bright white text is still too much causing eye strain. On Aldiko I use dark grey text on black. Perfect contrast at night in the dark. Amazon please add this basic feature so I can read all my books in one place!!!

Great little app but desperately needs Text To Speech ('TTS') in order to satisfy accessibility requirements to allow users to listen to books in a more leisurely fashion and to eliminate possibility of eye strain. Many Android devices already include a built-in TTS engine so all that needs developing is a Setting option to hook into this system setting. Come on Amazon... please make this tiny little code change - then you will get a 5 star rating from me.

I love amazon and kindle so much than any other things because of the wide range of books low money and good app and device kindle but I always in need black layout with white wordsplease. I just love them. They will surely reduce my eye strain. Thank you byt overall amazing app but at times it freezes which annoys me a lot.

Can't seem to find any version of a dark night mode for reading kindle books in the dark without a bright white screen causing eye strain in a dark room. If one gets added or if someone can reply to this post instructing me how to do it I'll upgrade my rating accordingly. Using this app on a Galaxy s10e.
Great app with limitations. Biggest issues is that when reading comics you can't enlarge the panels to a point where eye strain isn't an issue. Hope they fix this.

I don't know why the Kindle app brightness trumps the system brightness setting. Is it bad for my eyes when reading in almost complete darkness to have the screen as dim as possible? Might I suggest a pop-up to tell me I might cause eye strain if that is the reason.

Books work and you can customize it for the least amount of eye strain my only issue is that there's no scrolling. It's kind of cute that it's like turning pages but part of why I don't read often is because I can't focus on a page at a time like the app forces me to. So overall it's good I just wish I had the option to scroll instead of turning pages.
Nice. No eye strain.

Good app does what a book does + extras. love the built in Thesaurus that helps you learn tricky new words as you go. also good highlighting and book marking functions. Dark mode also Greta to reduce eye strain if reading at night.

Also glad they support manga style right to left since most translations keep that style when importing. Still not super happy with any comic book reader I've tried yet but reading books on this app works great as long as I use computer glasses that help prevent eye strain.

I was using this app with until one day the background was dimly lit and I could find no control to make it brighter. I wear glasses & this might be a deal breaker as I need the light to avoid eye strain. Other than that is a great reader love the way it automatically book marks across all devices. I've sent a message to the developer through the app if this I issue is adjustable and I simply can't find it then I recommend the app. Is the only reason I did not give 5 stars.
Word runner is a cool featurebut pls add a sliding mode like in news channels. That reduces the eye strain even better.
Features are ok.But there is not a option of reduce of eye strain.

it is actually very helpful.. and it is also cheaper when compared with printed prices.. however i recomened an ebook reader such as a kindle for the health conditions in the eyes. it gives us a huge eye strain

For 99% of my uses this app is great. I use it on dark mode to prevent eye strain. But for some ungodly reason many of my books (purchased from Kindle rather than my documents) display with dark grey font and a black background. No issues with other themes. I wish there was an option to force a style override.
Finally I can catch up on books without my kindle. Works great with black background and white letters for eye strain.

I really like the readability adjustments I can make to prevent eye strain. I'm aging and I need large text on a dark background. On Kindle I can have it all without having to shrink a page before turning it. Thanks.
Are there any other back light colors besides sepia greenblack and white? I'm looking for different colors for my eye strain..

I was a bit leery to try the app on my phone because my eyesight isn't the best and didn't want to end up with a font so big I only had four words per screen. However the print is clear and easily read. I use the sepia setting to avoid eye strain. Books download and sync up with my actual Kindle very quickly with no fuss. I am glad I gave the app a shot.
I really enjoy the kindle app. Now I wear glasses I prefer it on my Kindle Fire rather than my phone just for eye strain on a small screen. Brilliant app though.

Brilliant app on my archos 101 clear display allows prolonged reading without eye strain and syncs my books perfectly. OK a kindle is better especially in outdoor conditions but i'm quite happy to use tablet as an e-reader and have everything else at my fingertips too. A1 app
Combine with Eye Care to reduce eye strain. Love the carousel and collections features. Going back and forth to store can cause freezing though hope it's fixed soon.
I love the different colors you can make the screen. Less eye strain at night when reading in bed
Easy to use. No eye strain whatsover. Will recommend it to all the potential readers
Happy to find settings to reduce eye strain.

I love this app. Lets me take my 'book' anywhere with less chance of forgetting it somewhere. Also love that I can adjust the size of the print as well as soften the background to reduce glare and eye strain.
I have been using Kindle for over a decade. It's easy to purchase books and ways to read that make eye strain less.

I love the fact that I have a choice of so many books no matter where I am. Technology allows me to increase font size and reduce eye strain. (I am retired and still love reading).The lighting on the app. is adjustable and helps so much especially for night time reading. I have lost so many books because of lending the out and not getting them back. That can't happen now.

Life Changing. as an avid reader I love bringing my entire library along with a bookstore everywhere I go! As a Prime Member I can always find free books to supplement my favorite authors. Best purchase I have made in a very long time. No eye strain like a computer may give with its backlit screen. Adjustable font to enlarge for tired eyes after too much screen time at work. Easy to search for titles. See what's read or unread easily. How far along you are in the book by percent. Perfect!

It seems android users arnt really that welcome in the kindle community. As useful and handy as this app should be to someone who reads as much as I do the simple fact that you CANNOT adjust text size is truly pathetic. For those who require glasses or get eyestrain having to suffer through text this small is a nightmare.

I love that this app syncs across all of my devices to the furthest page read. And I love the customization options! It's great to be able to change the background color letter size font and brightness all of which can reduce eyestrain. Great job.
You gotta love the features!.The reading setting help reduce eyestrain. Highlighting notetaking and dictionary lookup save hours of study time weekly

Luvin it. I do not own a kindle. So I guess I don't know what I'm missing. What I DO have is my entire library at my fingertips. Can read whatever whenever & wherever I want. Different colors of backgrounds & choice of letter sizes to help with any kind of eyestrain there might be a problem with. I like to read in bed. No fumbling with the pages. Just tap to the next one. Can even adjust how bright it is so as not to bother my husband. No fumbling to turn off a light. Also great space saver

For me it's intuitive. I can do with the app what I have on my mind. I can highlight a word or a set of words when I turn on after leaving the app it tells me where I left off. I can search my personal kindle library with ease. When using my mobile I can photographed a page and save to storeage in my case Google Keep with that screen shot I can crop a section of it like a graph or diagram and save. It's easy to read in terms of eyestrain. I like it.
Great...helps me get 'more' reading done since i have glaucoma.

Until today I had few problems with this appbut due to light sensitivity have always used dark or night mode. This does not work any more as of 07:30 this morning and does have an effect on the course that I am working on.

I use this more than i use my phone as an actual phone. *Edit* Due to the latest update I have lost a lot of ability to use this app while I have a headache due to light sensitivity. This is heart breaking as reading in dark mode (with my brightness all the way down and blue light turned off) was one of the things I could do to take my mind off of my misery when a migraine hits. I might as well go back to actual books. At least they don't *glow*.

Bring back Read Aloud! 'TalkBack' accessibility through the phone settings is tolerable at best. Please copy Google Play Books 'Read Aloud' functions that highlight what's being read while displaying the full page without the content/navigating bar covering a large portion of the page with dark mode enabled for readers with light sensitivity. Amazon is the only place I could find my e-textbook that I can excess on Kindle app to take anywhere. Please put 'Read Aloud' feature within the Kindle app
App refuses to open. I'm using my tablet and it says its not compatible. Smdh. I have low vision and this is the only way to read

Ebooks are such a wonderful idea but Amazon really ruins it with the app. On the version that came on my Fire 7 they have light text on light backgrounds over all they have small and icons that cannot be zoomed and they don't have a speech generator to allow you to listen to books that do not have audio. This could be such a wonderful tool for people with low vision but they don't support that usage in their library or store sections of the app.
Great way to read books for people with low vision.
Love the Kindle App. Easy to purchase books snd listen to them. I have low vision and this makes it easier for me.

It is a good app. I have enjoyed while reading book on this app. Downloaded purchased books store on cloud of this app so you can read it anywhere on any device. It is very nice reading experience. You might use highlight text options text size options low vision option and also control brightness of app while reading and much more options which made reading experience nice. It's wonderful app. I would like to recommend it for easy access.
Best way to read books. I have macular degeneration and I can adjust font and etc for better and easier reading.
Font size too small for these old eyes no way to select larger fonts.
Why the heck isn't there an option to show other books by the same author like on the website? Looks like they found a way to make the store text smaller and harder for old eyes to see.
Convenient. My old eyes just need to figure out how to enlarge fonts.

This is a great app. Given the small size of my phone screen I was worried my poor old eyes would struggle to read the text. No worries! It's easy and very convenient. I've already downloaded enough books to last several months.
I love this Kindle app! Its so easy and convenient to find buy and read books on my tablet. Also I can change font size to help my old eyes to see. Great app!

I always have a book no matter where I go. I love my Kindle e-readers (yes I own three) because I am never without something to read. One goes everywhere I go while one is on the bedside table. The third one stays next to the recliner. I would much rather read than watch TV. One feature these old eyes appreciate is that text size can be changed for easier reading. Another great feature is that the Kindle will sync across all devices.
Great app plenty of options for making it comfortable for my old eyes.

Great I LOVE THIS WONDERFUL APP! I love my books in my library yet my old eyes are starting to .... get old. But this app has given me such beautiful light to see my HOLY BIBLE and study God's Word and share it with my family and friends. Thank You for this MAGNIFICENT APP! Praise the Lord God Almighty for He is worthy to be PRAISED AND STUDIED DAILY! GOD BLESS EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU TO MAKE SURE WE CAN READ WITHOUT HAVING TO PACK OUR PURSES ETC WITH WEIGHT.

Good app but some books don't scroll in single page mode. Mostly good the single pane mode for graphic novels works well but some books just don't work in single page mode and I'm partially sighted. You don't find out which ones until you've bought them which is very annoying.
I'm partially sighted and unable to read normal books. So this is a lifesaver.

I'm partially sighted. . Reading is one of my favorite things to do. when my eyes got bad. I couldn't read books anymore. A lady I met in store to me about Kindles. now.. with large font and a magnifier I'm back in business. kindles are a God send to me.

If you have photophobia like me the removal of dark mode in all amazon apps (this and shopping) recently will render it unusable. And make you rather disinclined to purchase anything from the customer-unfriendly downslide this company has been on for years. Hint hint Amazon.

This app used to be worth 4 stars (lost 1 star for inability to search only Prime books) but easily lost another star by removing 'Themes' from the Settings menu. I suffer from photophobia (no I'm not afraid of photographs) so bright light hurts my eyes to the point where migraines can be triggered. Now that Dark Theme is no longer an option for this app it has literally become painful to use. Customer service was no help: I was told to go to Settings and Themes. Thanks. Appreciate it.

I have diabetic retinopathy in my good eye. It is hard for me to read my ebooks on my smartphone so I read them on my notebook computer. When I can afford it I might invest in a tablet ... probably during the holiday season. It is a good program nonetheless. I have had it on my computer for more than a few years.

Without Kindle Reading Would Be a Chore! I have retinopathy Without Kindle it would be very difficult for me to read books. I love the black screen-white font feature. I have to increase the font size to be able to read at the speed I used to do in paper books. Kindle is awesome.

Extremely poor support for screen readers won't turn pages automatically. Google Play Books does it... Also a terrible mess of pop ups and non-intuitive navigation. This app makes me buy fewer books from Amazon.
This app is promoted as having a screen reader. This is a lie. What you can do is purchase an audiobook at an additional discounted price for a small selection of titles.
Not my favorite text-to-speech poorly integrated using Android Screen Reader compared to Google Books with its Read Aloud feature.
Like the app on general but when switching from my Kindle device to my phone I really miss the screen reader option - don't know why the app doesn't seem to offer it.
very good but some of the terms used on the screen reader can be hard going and some of the descriptions of images lack the information required in the text.

To me Kindle is the best thing since salty buttered popcorn. Whether you buy the audio books or not you can use your screen reader with Kindle or you can kick back with a soothing beverage of your choice and do it the old fashioned way and read. Always a good value and they have EVERYTHING...

Thankful for the enabled text to speech option. I love how it just reads the whole book without me having to turn every page. it's still a robotic voice but it sounds decent much better than other screen reader software.

I don't mind most of the changes but I can't seem to get the font to change. Used to love the black background with white text very easy on my light sensitive eyes. Now stuck with black on white and THEIR chosen font size. Needs fixing/revert NOW!

I would give it 5 stars but I can't adjust the brightness of the screen. Its really annoying when I adjust the setting on my Samsung Galaxy 3 and as soon as I open to page I was reading its as bright as ever! Very annoying for someone with sensitive eyes like myself.

My favorite app on my phone. I love that I can customize the book text size and font as well as the color for my super sensitive eyes. Easy to use tells me my reading speed and suggests other titles to read

So I've been using the Kindle app for years and have hundreds of titles. The latest update has made it nearly impossible for me to use it though. As far as I can tell they took away Dark Mode for some strange reason. I'm sight impaired and the more light there is the less I see. I can't really tell what I'm looking at in the main library page now without wearing my protective sunglasses. Also I can't seem to download anything. I HATE THIS! For reading this is a brilliant app but for listening the app needs some work. For someone who is sight impaired the controls are very challenging especially compared to amazon's audible. Look forward to this app becoming more user friendly then will certainly rate the app 5 stars

kindle is exactly what I need to continue the pastime that I love I can increase the size of the print and backlighting is essential ideal for people who do not want to disturb their partner while reading in bed and ideal for people who have sight problems . kindle books are so affordable.

This does not have text to speech in the app & Amazon does not know when it will have it available. So I cant listen to my old books while working. I hate the talk back feature on the phone. I know I can get it to work with talk back but it is troublesome and affects all the functions of my phone plus I have to keep the screen on and don't dare touch anything or it will stop. The program is very good those who like reading from the screen it is perfect. It cooperates nicely with talk back reading aloud. It only lacks one thing: so that it will continue to read aloud with the turned off screen but it really is the most important feature I am looking for.

Since the update It no longer continuosly reads my book I have to manually turn every page so I will probably be deleting this app this was the thing I loved most about kindle was that I could just put the talkback on and away it went I'm using samsung tablet so I'm assuming apple users are the only ones that can benefit from this app now

There is a feature i want that I think lots of people has been asking about. Add the feature where when your reading a book and there Is an option at the top that says 'read aloud'. I store many Publications on my Android phone. When I open up a USA Today for example the publication date does not show on the first page of the text version any other page or in the article list. Lack of publication date means I cannot determine which issue I am reading in order to come back to the publication or to delete the publication. Sometimes when I tired of reading the publication I want to switch to text-to-speech. I have found it impossible to listen to page after page using Google's TalkBack. I would like to see Amazon include a text to speech setting in Kindle like they include on the Washington Post app for Android.

Great app for accessing Kindle books. The highlights and quick switching of pages are some really awesome features as well as the plethora of different reading formats and syncing. I really wish the Text to Speech feature from the Kindle Fire reading app were available in Android but Amazon support states we have to suffice ourselves with Android TalkBack feature which is very annoying. There are probably commercial reasons for this...anyway overall still a great app.

Visually great user interface is easy and attractive... But it's 2016 and TTS functionality is missing. I know there are workarounds like enabling 'TalkBack' in Android's accessibility settings. Or converting to different formats to use with other e-readers. These are frustrating options. I like the Kindle app. I would love to see the option for TTS built-in to the app. This would improve accessibility for people with disabilities. Even better would be using natural sounding voices. Please add TTS :)
I would give it 5 stars if it too would have the read aloud feature for Android like in Google books. TalkBack is just a huge hassle.

Wonderful to see that I can read books with TalkBack although 'continuous read' only seems to read a page? And I can't see where to turn publisher fonts on or off. It's almost perfect. Request *1: make it easier to pause and resume text to speech via TalkBack (Galaxy S4). *2 In the 'About this Book' page half the time I hit '+More' it doesn't work. Otherwise spot on!
Thank you for talkback support!
I'm new to reading/audio books due to vision impairment so far so good
Awesome way for me to read cheaply and with a vision impairment that I can adjust lighting makes it so much better.

The most recent update removed Dark Mode from the settings menu. I un/reinstalled per customer service and it was there the first time I opened the app and now has disappeared again. I have vision issues and need dark mode to keep from hurting my eyes... ready to switch to Nook.

So disappointed the continuous scroll isn't supported on the pixelbook or slate. Will this be supported soon? Seems like the only tablets (all Chromebooks apparently) that it doesn't work on. I love this feature as I hate swioing. I read large print due to vision issues and have to swipe a million times while reading a book. It gets annoying to do this literally every couple seconds.
Love being able to read again ....vision issues
Never used another reader but this seems flawless and bugless. Honestly don't see the need to have a separate device for reading unless you have vision issues or a specialized application.

I used to be an avid reader but I developed vision issues and reading traditional books became almost impossible for me. Kindle changed all of that for me. It has been like a miracle for me. I can change fonts background colours etc. Now I can enjoy reading again. Thanks Kindle!! 💖

Works just fine on my iPod and android phone... But my android tablet not so much. It will show my books I have but when I try to read them I just get a blank page. If I try to swipe a page or tap a page the screen changes and says before you go please rate this book. Very frustrating because with vision problems its a whole lot easier to read my books on my tablet. Please fix!!
Works great with my tablet and windows phone. Just one kink though it used to be able to get large print which is great for people with vision problems. Since the update the print isn't that large.
I love Kindle reading!!! I have a vision problem so I love I can easily enlarge the print quite large.

Love this Kindle app ... it's the best! Easy way to access all your books in one place. I have a vision problem and really like how you can increase the font size ... as well as choose a font that is easy to read.
Amazon chooses not to allow Androids text to speech functionality to work within its app making it useless for those with visual impairments.

Very limited font range text size range is an insult (jumps straight from small to huge) only high contrast colour schemes and even the narrow margins take up most of the screen. Why such limited customisations? I have very mild visual impairments and can't read on this at all. Convert your books to epub with Calibre and use Aldiko or Moon+ instead.

Please give us back the carousel feature! This new design is too small & nearly inaccessible for those of us with visual impairments! I don't see how things were improved but I'll just keep searching for alternatives.
the best thing about reading your books on Kindle is that you can enlarge the page if you are somewhat visually challenged which is great for me

I am visually impaired and books are required to attend school. I cannot get kindle to read them aloud so my wife has to read them to me as I take notes. Kindle you suck! Google PlayBooks will read them to me. I only buy Amazon books as a last resort.
Cant believe there is no text to speech... discrimatory towards visually impaired for that 1 star

My main reason for wanting to use Kindle books was to be able to have them read to me via a 'text to speech' engine. The Kindle devices made by Amazon and most of the decent e-book reading apps include this feature but kindle for android does not. This makes the app completely useless for a visually impaired person such as myself. There is no excuse for not enabling this functionality. I am not going to carry around a separate larger device (larger than my phone) just for reading Kindle books. Instead I will purchase books elsewhere. I have been following this issue on forums for visually impaired people for years and there is a large community of people who have the same problem. Amazon is losing business because of this. Many people (not me of course) also illegally remove the DRM from their kindle books ONLY so they can have a different e-reader 'read' the book to them. Even if this is not your issue please leave a negative note for the app until they fix it. This is a basic accessibility issue. The software to fix it is commonplace and easy for them to add. It is clearly a choice the company is making not to...

Problematic for visually impaired. (Android App only). Font size doubles from medium-large to very large in a single step. [All web browsers (tested 4) apps from Scribd Overdrive Libby etc. and Kindle for IOS have multiple in-between text sizes.]

SUCKS. Why no TTS? This app is useless if you are visually impaired and need text-to-speech. And now the stupid app commandeers my brightness settings forcing me to use a BLAZING bright setting in the pitch dark. Who are the RETARDS developing this app?

Audible has brought the love of reading to me a legally blind person. The app is easy to use and works perfect with Google TalkBack. Listening to books while hands free makes doing any task more pleasant.

I switched to audio as reading on packed commuter trains was becoming difficult. Also I find being in a air-conditioned office all day gives me sore/dry eyes. Using audio I can still progress my latest novel or stomach a text book. App is very easy to use. Sound quality also very good.

Accompanying PDF feature is completely useless. No pinch zoom and no way to download and view in another app. In dark mode contrast on previous and next buttons way too low. An app like this should get things right every time for people with low vision.
