Excellent app great choice of books. The only downside is the very small control buttons and menus are not very user friendly for the visually impaired please make these much larger.

I am visually impaired and have almost 100 different audiobooks. The ability to access my audio library in an organized easy to operate interface is key. Audible also seems to work decently with iOS and Android vocal commands. There have been accessibility glitches but the updates have fixed them. Audible's credit system is as it always has been fantastic. Paying ahead does equal paying significantly less in the long run

I am visually impaired and for me services such as Audible are a lifeline. Audible for Android is well designed. Great choice. I have been an audible member for 7 years and never had a problem. Crucially the app is not a drain on battery life.
Easy to navigate. A lifesaver for visually impaired in lock-down.

LOVE AUDIBLE I'm visually impaired so listening to my favourite authors is brilliant especially if linked to my Kindle where I can adjust size to my liking. There is an amazing choice of authors genre to choose from. The narrators are also very good and sometimes they have introduced me to new authors I would have thought of buying.
good camera but blind user TalkBack user not read Shooter button please fixed and face detection
i like old eyes colour function
Basically a friend is using this app as well as me and he's partially blind and has the visual aids on his phone but won't allow him to like the heart button could you please get back in touch asap

These guys are crooks. Beware of their one-click payment system. If you are partially sighted like me you are one click away from throwing money away. And when you get charged for services that you didn't order Badoo doesn't inform you. PayPal will alert you of your undesired charges a couple of days later. Customer service is worse than useless and quite rude. I had to register a complaint with PayPal and with great effort and time I was reimbursed. BEWARE!! BEWARE!! BEWARE!!
The chat message are not beening read by a screen reader called Talk Back

I'm using a screen reader as I'm visually impaired. In the past I could find the options for YES NO MAYBE very easily when deciding to like someone or not. Now the screen reader reads me all this BUTTONS which I haven't a clue what they are. More or less where on someone's profile does one find the YES NO MAYBE options? I'm going to deactivate and uninstall my baddoo because I now noticed I a screen reader user can't even find where to right a message to someone. So this app is not useful.

This app used to be very good because it was once compactabl with talkback software but it stopped reading messages to visually impaired persons. So I don't think that's fair on this persons parths as the app is no longer friendly to them.

app_name: Bible App for Kids: Audio & Interactive Stories
review_text: i'm sorry to have to rate this app so poorly and to have to uninstall it. .i was really looking forward to something like this but it turned out to .be totally inaccessible to blind people using a screen reader. hope .something can be done about it but I doubt it.
Not vision accessable. CANT ADAPT TYPE SIZE FOR LOW VISION. Screen zoom and font size MAXIMUM. UNINSTALL

Seems like a good app to have except it has no real capabilities for vision impaired people! The screen reader on your phone is not very useful unless you can see what's going on on the screen! I think that if you want more people in that catalog 2 take it or take to it you might want to think about that
This app is so awesome but now in new update there is problem with talkback user to go live so please solve this problem

Disappointed. I am blind in one eye. It is very noticeable to look at me. There is no option to make my bitmoji show this. Not even an option to make one eye different from the other. No shapes for lips either. No shoes for females.

Just wish it was a bit more accessible. Being blind it sometimes it does not work. Also it is a bit hard to use it with keyboards. There should be a button to easily access it like you can do with the other emojis. Also making that accessible would be great. Like when you use voice to text you just say the name of the emoji (ex heart smiley face crying emoji) it will put it on there

A lot of fun to play with and it's humorous when my boyfriend and I exchange entire conversations without using any text. The only reason I didn't give it a 5? Could bitmoji be a little more inclusive for people who are disabled aka spoonies? Wheelchair service dog hearing aids walking stick for the blind as accessories. 'Spoonie Life' w/ both a smile and a grimace for those who have invisible stuff? We share the 'best' phone (a lot) in our family. So it would be nice too be able to switch and log out of mine log into his etc. Or swap persons within one account. I guess the another dream I would have is for Petamojis with different breeds of dogs cats popular reptiles birds... especially if once you picked an animal you could change the colors or weight. Our Chihuahua is part of our family & he often has stuff to say about or to his Mom & Dad too! (I think a cat Petamoji with 'Then my human did this...' would spawn a million conversations) Last it would be awesome (as an added paid option maybe?) To be able to import/combine bitmoji profiles on the same device or account to make 'couples' or 'family' 'Me & my pet' stickers With the various default words and phrases. So there you go...add some spoonie accessories like wheelchair hearing aids etc and I will happily come back and upgrade to a five... But think about the multiple petsonas Petamojis etc? @BrendaEckels BrendaTheWriter

This app is not visually impaired friendly. I'm legally blind and cannot clearly make out everything on the screen so I depend on a screen reader to describe to me what I'm tapping on. There is no description of anything when tapping on the features of this app. Therefore anyone who depends on a screen reader to describe what they are doing on the app will not be able to make their own bitmoji
blind but i think its great ovr you could make it more accessible for that's on the TalkBack settings for blind people individuals blind individuals

I love this app it is really fun to customize emojis to look more like yourself... If I had any complaints it is the limited places in use allowed by other apps for these bitmojis. Work on compatibility or especially considering I am visually impaired the ability to save or even voice dictate from a certain set of emojis would be extremely helpful! Otherwise this is a fun and fairly intuitive app.

app_name: Bleacher Report: sports news- scores- & highlights
review_text: They changed it so now the app is all white. You will blind yourself at night unless they make it dark again or add a dark mode

app_name: Bleacher Report: sports news- scores- & highlights
review_text: As far as sports news it's a good app. My complaint is that I can't read the extremely thin font on my phone. For those of us with old eyes it's a problem. I find myself just giving up and closing the app.

Being colour blind I find it difficult to tell between the green and yellow - perhaps an option to customise colours? The csv file puts all data into one column excel doesn't automatically sort it into columns. If these issues were sorted it would be perfect :)
I love the big bright numbers and the simplicity of this app. It's good for people with vision problems like me and I wanted something that wasn't too complicated. Thank you!
I'm visually impaired and the app is no longer compatible with dark mode so I can no longer see the app to use itl
I'm visually impaired and find the app easy to use with a straight forward layout. I've found some stunning properties on here.
Was one of the easiest apps for me to use especially because I'm visually impaired
Works well. Fonts are a little small and low contrast for old eyes.
Works well. Fonts are a little small and low contrast for old eyes.
It is a really nice app. We only neee minutes to get the answers. But the only problem is their moderators are blind and deaf to some serious biologycal questions please check them
This app is not very usable for blind people that use talkback the screen reader built into android lots of buttons without content descriptions

better than Tinder but it needs a dark mode to reduce eyestrain for those of us who are neurodiverse (and those who use screens a lot which is everyone now). Come on it's 2020. Edit: come on it's 2021.

There is no point to the paid version i tested it. They also just repeatedly show you people you have already liked or disliked because people are not using the app at scale. ( I live in a major city ). If you have the paid version and can see who likes you you realise they just show up first in the stack anyway and if you dislike them they show up again in a short amount of time. They also use dark ux/ui patterns to make it hard to remove your credit card details and then refuse refunds. Design fails accessibility and is troublesome for people with vision impairments. I raised this with them and their response was ' well other people could do it...'. Company lacks empathy and no human elements just like the app.
App won't let you edit content with large font for people visually impaired. I got booted from nimble for reacting to another person's questions the wrong way.

Took so long to install I didnt use it. Log in sign up pain in butt not working to log in later. Basically never worked and takes up space. You need a mobile site order set up not an app Not everyone can have apps like Work phones. Or older /limited smart phones or people who just dont want apps. I dislike that everyone wants an app. I like that I can use Sites and Those sotes apps can translate for Non English or even blind people your app is not friendly for ESL Disabled people or Elderly
it's confusing to me I'm blind and this app needs more for us who are site less
Im blind and found it east to navigate *appreciated

What a pile. I really hate web wrapper apps and that's basically what this app is now. Things are slower to react and TalkBack accessibility takes a hit because people want to be lazy. Now they've gone and changed the sign-in method so it's not a standard username/password. At least things are mostly labeled so I can tell what links to tap.
One thing I hate are inaccessible surveys. The fail survey showed four images on the screen and talkback could read none of the questions! Talkback incompatible survey *a11y fail!

A nice concept though the deals are the same as most sales. It would be better if the deals were different. Give a different deal every week to make it better. I love the menu on the app. Though I wish it had the magnifier option for us that are visually impaired.
I'm legally blind and used to love the calculator. Now I can't see it anymore with the new changes.

I am obsessed with dark theme but this app doesn't has an option of night mode or dark theme .I don't hate the UI completely but the problem is when we use it in night .I was doing maths one night when everybody was asleep then I opened the calculator for some log calculations to save time and I got blind due to much light .I highly recommend to add the dark theme.
This is a nice little app. It is clean and stable. It is very blind accessible. It is the kind of work I expect from Google.
Its white. Black was great. Until i turned blind because of the white theme. Bad. Very bad update. Update: has dark mode already

**UPDATE 5-22-19 finally have dark theme. Thank you!** Why was dark theme removed!? Why can't you ADD new features instead of REPLACE previous ones. You all should know by now that no one likes this blinding white theme you keep changing your apps to. At least give us the option to switch between Dark or Snow Blind White
New colour is horrible cheap and giving eye strains.

I assumed there might be options for colors or some sort of improvement... I was wrong. Instead we received the same blindingly eye strain inducing eye vomit theme. I admire the fact that they wanted to make a simplistic change but this leaves the app looking and feeling like haphazardly slapped together experiment
It USED to be a great app. Recent upgrade made this a very annoying eye straining app. Please give us the option to go back to previous version.

I was very happy with this app... Until this new update. I can barely look at the screen without eyestrain. White? Seriously? How about letting us choose our own color scheme. Please give us that update. This current app is too harsh on the eyes.

Latest review (06-09-19) - The dark mode is finally here. I will post back about functionality as I learn about it. Previous Review (09-Nov-18) - No dark/night mode :( I want to stay loyal to google since their apps are quite neat. But everything is too lit for my photosensitive eyes. Please add dark/night mode option to this app. And if you are reading this believe me most of your users would appreciate a dark/night mode on all the apps wherever possible.
I prefer the background to be black due to my visual impairment

As a visually impaired user I find the new blue button s horrendous. It is incredibly hard to tell which symbol is on which button. Also: What is the point of having nice big buttons if you use a small font. Please give us an option to have the keypad in bold or increase font size.

Old technology! Overall the app has everything I need to manage my diabetes and diet. But the UI just sucks and it's one of the few apps that absolutely ignore all requests for a dark mode. I'm partially blind and looking at a bright white screen just kills my eyes. I'd happily pay for the premium version again if the developers make a change to offer display options.
Please bring back the old colors. The new colors are ugly and they aren't color blind friendly!

The app works pretty well. It is a little sluggish on my Galaxy s5 but no major issues. However it would be really nice if they would label all of the buttons for the benefit of those who are blind and can not see the graphics that represent the buttons like myself.

This app has helped me in a great way to maintain a healthy diet. The only downside to it and it is not the fault of the app itself is that some of the database entries for foods are incorrect. If I had only one desire it would be that some verification procedure could be established to ensure accuracy of entries which are placed into the database . All in all this app deserves 5 stars in my humble opinion. One last thought: developers thank you for making this app accessible to blind users! I am one!

It's pretty easy to use. I'm extremely low vision and I can use this. I love that it balances my exercise with my calorie intake. I actually tend to not eat enough. This upsets the dieticians. It also slows weight loss who knew? Now I know if I'm not eating enough or if I'm eating too much.

I've used this app off and on for many years. They recently changed the font in the app to tiny and there is no way to change it back or make it large text. I sent them a request for help with no response for days now. I can no longer use the app because I've had vision loss and need the large print. In order to use myfitnesspal I have to go online. The app should have an option to enlarge the text. People with low vision cannot use this app.

I love this app. It's very user friendly for my old eyes and brain ... my son gave me a quick overview and I dove right in and embraced it from the get go. I enjoy reading the blog articles all are very informative and helpful. The food search in the diary section is amazingly loaded I have found pretty much every kind of odd and end food imaginable in their listing. I am in my third week of using it and it only takes about a minute to log in my daily entries so simple!
Nice app but it could use a dark mode night theme for people with sensitive eyes then ill give the 5 🌟

I use it with TalkBack and it repeats saying 'main activity' when I move my finger towards the bottom of the diary screen. This happens almost on 8 spots on the Diary page and is very uncomfortable. The other thing is that the add ingredient window doesn't has the 'most recent' option. I would suggest creating a connection between the 'most recent' searched foods in the add food to Diary page and add ingredients page so I can find my recent items and add them as ingredients to my new recipes.

It's kind of not accessible to people that use chromebooks and who are blind and visualy impared I'd suggest that once you select the templates it takes you to the canvas and the templates don't show anymore. There should be an insert button instead of tabs.
I love the previous version because it is easier to use and less eye strain. Hope Canva will continue with the previous version. 😢However I still love using Canva for my work. 😊
the app for editing graphic design is completely amazing :) but it could have the dark mode feature for user accessibility so as not to impair the editor's vision or visually impaired :(
I would have really preferred to use my debit card then to put in all my numbers. I am blind in one eye and found it very hard to input all of those numbers again.
I love being able to have the ability to access my account at my fingertips and see it an do what needs done with my phone especially since I'm going blind
great app! very easy to use large print for us blind folks. detailed breakdown of purchases/balance. super fast and easy to make a payment. i wish all apps were this easy to use!

As a BLIND USER of the CapitalOne Mobile app I am INDEILIBLY THANKFUL to CapitalOne for making its mobile app fully accessible. Thanks for a jobe well done. I give CapitalOne 100 over 100 forsuch a great mobile app!
I am legally blind so the update is great! I can view it without having to be super close to the screen I love that my bank and credit card info are in one place.
Easy to read since I'm legally blind and so easy to use. I love this app.

As a legally blind person I love the fact that gender interface is very blind friendly in easy reuse I to all my business through your app and it's so convenient it is pay my monthly bills without having turn speak to anybody whatsoever thank you for making inaccessible Interface is the word I was supposed to use were made no sense I'm using arrow texel do excuse me of some things do not make any sense at the moment

easy to use and experience is great. As a blind person I am still able to fully use this app. Thank you capital one for the attention to detail to make your app accessible and usable for the blind and visually impaired. Keep it up and remember that you have blind and visually impaired who use this app as well
Love the new ap! I have low vision and this makes it easy to pay
I think you need to adjust the print for low-vision people who would need to have larger print
Pay line needs to be larger for old eyes.
Easy to use and large enough to see with my old eyes. Thanks.

I recently switched from another bank that had a great website and app but this app does not even let me sign in. Worse yet I am Blind and their website is not fully accessible with my screen reader and Capitol One states under accessibility that they have followed all guidelines to make their website accessible. Worse yet I wrote accessibility twice and have yet to hear back. Between the app and the website I am going to have to switch.
The functionality for transactions is fine. However it does not work well with larger fonts screen readers or screen magnifier software.
Found this app to be easy to work with as well as useful. It also works well with Google Talkback. Finger print feature makes it that much easier. .
Error at sign in several times/only pattern worked well. I am 70 with vision issues and I just can't do this over and over.
I love the app it is very easy to use. I have vision problems and with this app it does what it says I'm not trying to find this and that so thank you capital one. Terri Ballard

I really like being able to log in using a pattern that I create! I am visually handicapped and it is very difficult for me to see the letters on my smartphone when I am outdoors. Using my pattern to log in is perfect for me! I also love how easy it is to make instant transfers between CO360 accounts. I sometimes transfer money just in case I need it while running errands. Great app!

Hello I am a Capital One customer who is totally blind. But I have friends who are visually impaired who are also a customer. I would like to know on your next update can you put a dark screen mode button because it is a lot of strain on their eyes with a white screen background
I am visually impaired but find the app easy to use. The font is large and doesn't require a lots of manipulating.
Clear easy and to point.....especially for me since I'm visually impaired.

I absolutely love this! Especially because I am blind in my left eye and I did not know if it would still work and it does! It's exactly like I've been wishing VR was! Works amazing on the Samsung galaxy S5 ! I love you google :)
The images are blurry and not enjoying the eye strain.

I loved it. For such a price I truely do. But I started feeling motion sickness after using it for a few minutes. FPS is not that good when moving head its jittery like frame skips. But when kept the head in a single position its better. Also I had a little but negligible eye strain at the back of my eyes I dunno why. I don't wear spectacles. My phone has a 1080p screen with 400 PPI still I see the visuals pixelated.

I find the options for customer support to be lacking. I am a blind customer and there is very little accessibility option 4 getting help. When you contact the phone number all it does is give you instructions that are very much based on visuals rather than detailed descriptives. Making the ability to get support extremely difficult. And at this time there is no phone number where you can speak with an actual representative of the company.
I need help. I'm visually impaired.
Used to be a 4 until you got rid of the dark theme. I have photophobia & this change makes the app more difficult to use.
It's very good and accessible for blind people

It's been a while since I was able to use this app but since I've been using it I can't see my stuff on my phone or anything like that I can put money on it I can't access anything and they won't help me I'm getting older I have cataracts so it's hard for me to see what they're asking me on this phone I wish they would help me
great app coming from us bank this is a huge breath of fresh air app loads fast and shows me what I want to see immediately. my only wish is for dark mode I have very sensitive eyes so it helps alot
The new UI is horrible designed for blind ppl with bo option to switch back to the old nice UI.
Horrible new design. It's UXD that tries to be good for the legally blind and those over 80
I am color blind so this new update is the worst on me. How do I change the colors?
Is this the color blind scheme? This is a bad combination. Can we get a choice at least?! This and the order of my alarms is quite annoying not being sorted by time.

Thank you for the dark theme! I am legally blind and material white apps kill my eyes. I won't hold my breath for high contrast though. Thanks regardless. My eyes especially thank you. It would also be wise to add an option to choose the theme that fits the user best. I know I hated white themes being forced on me and I'm sure there's people who don't appreciate the black theme as their only option.

Could be a great app - but you need to TURN DOWN THE BRIGHTNESS! When my alarm goes off is the screen goes straight to maximum brightness. On my S21 Ultra it even overdrives the backlighting making it nearly impossible to see the screen. This is not only very painful in the moment for someone like myself with visual impairments and dry eyes but it sets the stage for a headache that lasts hours after waking up. Reddit posts from 2 years ago describe this exact problem. FIX IT OR ADD A SETTING!

today on 'what can we do to make an app unaccessible': let's change the background to an extremely intense dark blue that causes eye strain in some individuals with no way to change it! either make the background a more neutral colour or allow the option to change the colour scheme. since it's a preinstalled app i'd rather not waste storage and find a better one that doesn't cause me headaches but I might just have to.
I love this clock app but maybe aome colour change options would be nice to .reduce eye strain at night?
snooze/off symbols too small (not good for low vision). alarm volume and snooze not adjustable per alarm. limited music choices.

After my Pixel 5 updated to Android 12 the widget started using text colors selected by algorithm based off wallpaper color. I'm sight impaired so this makes it impossible to read the time now. I've tried using the Android accessibility options but they're obviously designed by Google engineers without vision issues who don't care. Why can't I just pick plain white text? I either have to use a plain black background to see the clock now or try to configure a third party app.
I really liked this when it was bright blue with red. I found it had suddenly changed to black with blue with no warning and having sight problems it's more difficult to see. Please change it back

Absolutely terrible they completely ruined a perfectly good app with the most recent update. Horrible UI horrible design decisions terrible colors and everything looks like it was designed for someone with vision issues. I loved this app before the update but then the redesign completely destroyed this app... Whoever's working at Google needs to seriously reconsider

Please stop messing with the UI. If you want to assist people with vision issues provide option in setting to increase icon and font sizes. I was comfortable seeing most of my alarms in 1 page and to read all those labels easily. The new designer thought labels are meaningless.

Red screen when alarm wakes is not a neutral color. Still wish to have the black n white version for people with vision problems you still have red color on button to set alarm which usually means stop even confused my 10yr old granddaughter. you should still have different color options. It wasn't broken why mess with it

looks like a good clock app wrt functionality except I couldn't find a light mode within the settings making it unusable for those of us who struggle to read white text on black (common with dyslexia and/or visual impairment). I'd expect this to be included as a basic accessibility option these days. disappointing.

Why do you want to choose low contrasting colors for menus and display screens? White on black was too basic functional and legible? Clock has joined other screens like the Contacts with low contrast colors. Light blue letters on blue background is a stupid choice if users cannot change it. There are visually impaired users who just cannot see these screens in a dimly lit room much less in daylight! Tiny type sizes that can't be changed make it even worse (company name & position in Contacts).
please allow for changing of the colors you turned the timer color dark blue which is too difficult to see for many visually impaired people

New update is terrible. Feels large and clunky. At least give the option to select desired theme if you're argument is that it was designed to help the visually impaired. For those wanting to go back go to app info click on 3 dots in the upper corner and uninstall updates. Make sure you go to play store and disable automatic updates.

Why did this app change from black and white to pink and purple with the last update? I hate it! I'm on Google Play right now looking for a new alarm clock app. I am visually impaired and the black and white was helpful to me the pink and purple makes it very difficult to see. I looked all through the app for an option to change the colors but found nothing. Please put it back the way it was! If it ain't broke don't fix it!

Two things for the UI/UX team: 1. The controls for snoozing an alarm on lock screen are extremely tiny and non-intuitive. Many people have weak eyes and it's just frustrating to find the tiny buttons to snooze/dismiss an alarm. They should be BIG high contrast and clear. 2. The plus button to add a new alarm is just gigantic and out of place with everything else. Yes it's material you but this must get smaller. Delicately put it's simply outrageous.

I am blind in 1 eye and partially in the other...I enjoy this app but sometimes I need to see it larger when traveling..I can't stream it from my phone or tablet...If I'm paying for it through Xfinity I should be able to Screen Mirror it from any device I own..I'll put it back on all of my devices when you fix that problem...if anyone pays for something they should be able to use it anywhere!!!!
Not inpressed. While the larger font is an improvement the lack of an index is annoying. Additionally a red color for breaking news makes it tough for the color blind to see.
CNN IS EASIER FOR ME BECAUSE I AM BLIND AND MY SMART PHONE TALK EVERY THING AND EVERY WHERE. SO I CAN THE NEW EVERY DAY AND I DON'T MISS THE NEWS.

I've waited for CNN to provide a setting that would allow users to switch from the current white text on black background to a standard black text on white. Unfortunately I am uninstalling due to the amount of eye strain required to read anything..

On the phone I have to infinitely scroll down to see the news. There is no option to turn the picture off for example so I can have an overview of the news items. The background changed from black to white when reading news and although it might be a personal preference white background is more eye straining and wasting battery power on some devices. I think at least a 'night mode' is needed. Font size is also a problem - it is best to be able to adjust the font size.

This version of the app sucks. In the older version I did not have to scroll and scroll and scroll to see what articles I wanted to read and the way the pictures flip on on the screen causes eye strain. The app is supposed to be about news and accessing it quickly not fancy and unnecessary graphics. I will be uninstalling the app and if I want to read CNN I will go to the website. Thanks for screwing up a good app.

CNN pressurised me into 'upgrading' by sending messages that I would no longer receive alerts. I caved in and upgraded. Frankly I prefer the previous version. You can no longer copy and paste. The white background is too bright at night and causes eye strain. I preferred navigation in the previous version. All said and done I'm disappointed.

I can maybe read 1 article before I have to stop reading because tof the eye strain from the white font on black background. Please ad an option in settings to reverse color scheme and I would happily give it 5stars. I understand black backgrounds save battery life but let the user decide of they want that.

I like getting my news from CNN & like this app but I can only read maybe one article & sometimes have to stop halfway because of eye strain due to black background a & small white letters. Wish I could customize color settings. Also frustrated that when I'm reading an article if my phone goes to sleep & I go right back it's at the top of the article instead of locking where I was at. Last the breaking news notifications should go to that article not the home page!
Congratulations you are the first to do it right in the mobile world. I love the fact that I don't get eye strain reading the articles.

I am sorry to admit but I am officially done with the CNN app. The stories were informative and everything but the app leaves a LOT to be desired. Most significantly it crashes CONSTANTLY. Opening articles loading even before anything even loads it crashes. I also think the design is awful. The eyestrain tiny white text on a black background causes is unbelievable. So sorry CNN. Your news is fine but this app needs a complete overhaul.
I have low vision and the font size at its 'largest' is barely even normal font. Too small to be of any value to anyone with low vision

I go to my CNN app every morning. I have macular degeneration and so I listen with my text to speech and am very pleased to have information permission about our world.. CNN is my go to for information.
Inability to change the font size makes this app useless for people with sight problems

Enjoy watching on all my devices. Only suggestion is that the video is not full screen when watching on a tablet which makes it hard to read the subtitles especially for those individuals with sight problems.
Good app but a dark mode would be helpful for folks with vision issues
On phones it is difficult to see details of photos and the app doesn't work in landscape mode and cannot be zoomed in or out. A problem for visually challenged individuals.
Why was the option to the adjuster fonts disabled some of us are visually impaired
Hard to navigate when you're visually impaired and need large font.
The text size is unusable for visually impaired users.

I expected more from CNN. The app is missing a basic accessibility feature namely the ability for a visually impaired person to either pinch and zoom or tap on images to make them larger. Also everytime a news article is loaded it reloads two additional times. So as a person is partway through reading an article it reloads and you have to find your place again. This happens a second time which adds to the frustration. It's kind of like someone slapping a newspaper out of your hand as your reading it. Finally some articles have a video which leads a person to believe the video will be about that particular article. Instead clicking on such videos just starts the live CNN feed so you don't get to watch what you were interested in unless it happens to be playing on the live feed when you click on it. All of this combined with slow load times (even on 4G LTE) is enough for me to switch to another news app.
Nice but you can't adjust font size it's hard to read for visually impaired

Great app! Use it daily with my other news reading. Is it possible to zoom in on photos graphs map images etc? I am losing my vision so zooming in on images would be helpful and I'm sure other visually impaired people would benefit greatly. Enlarging text works well though. Thank you.

app_name: Coinbase: Buy BTC- Ethereum- SHIB- Bitcoin Cash
review_text: Well i no like to refresh everything to see where the price is going why not update the app to be like robinhood when the price is always live and another think this need a dark mode like every other app i get blind even when i set my brightness too low

app_name: Coinbase: Buy BTC- Ethereum- SHIB- Bitcoin Cash
review_text: This app is great for getting into this bitcoin surge that happening right now. It's super easy to buy in and cash out. Takes all of the confusion of 'what's a wallet?' 'How do I buy coins?.... Okay now how do I sell them?' And turns it into something not dissimilar from mobile banking. Some things I would love to see improved on/added are: Dark mode! (Checking the market through this app just after waking up will blind you) Better widgits!!!! (I know not many people use them but I'd love to see how much USD I have in the market at a quick glance. Adjusting background occupancy and text color would be awesome too) More clear deduction of fees. My first time I chucked $30 from my debit card into BTC and I was wondering why only $28.01 went through when there was only a $1 fee listed. (3% fee for non-bank account transactions apparently) + the $1 fee listed for conversion equals my missing $1.99

app_name: Coinbase: Buy BTC- Ethereum- SHIB- Bitcoin Cash
review_text: you need dark mode look it is 2020.. ive been using this since 2017 and you really have had plenty of time to make a dark mode for this application and just choose not to -some people have sensitive eyes it is unfortunate how white coinbase is. everything else is fine im giving such a low rating because i want it to be noted that just not having a very easy to implement feature has made my experience so 'ugh' so to speak and it drops it a whole 2 starts over just that.
As someobe with sight impairment the ability to doubke tap on a comic pane to zoom in on that pabe and the dynamic way that I can progress through each pane has opened up comic books for me again
The guided view is great! I have vision problems and this app let's me enjoy comics again!

I have glaucoma and I purchased a smart phone for the first time and I was extremely happy but it's because I had a blue background when I was using messages and the calling screen had a beautiful royal blue for my distorted vision I could see everything well but now I can not see ANYTHING which is hurtful to my vision with this white screens people should bring a lawsuit against this or sign some sort of petition Google plum communist !!!!!!!!!!

Seems that the people want options. The reviews I read are about customizing displays a little so it doesn't feel so big brother and controlled. Like why do I need a rainbow list of letters for contacts that have no profile picture uploaded (ie every contact)? I absolutely love the Dark Mode to reduce eye strain. ANYWHERE I can I try to turn this feature On.
Recent update made colors look terrible and background eyestraining bright white.
I am overwhelmed as I expected the low vision..I feel happy

I have old eyes and the MD easter egg theme is difficult to use and makes me think if I have to put up with candy themes and autocratic design decisions I might as well switch to iOS and get a less intrusive phone OS. Please give me a dark option asap and give me a reason to be loyal to google!

So its a great app and everything however i'd like to see some indication on the info page of the films whether the film has Audio Description cuz its very frustrating when i want to watch a movie with my blind dad and have to start playing the movie before we know if it has AD or not.

this is a great app. It is very stable and easy to use It is so nice to have my files right on my device. The app is very blind friendly.

TONS OF UPDATES LATER... The devs have the audacity to charge $10 a moth and YET ALL MY 5+ YEARS OF BEGGING TO HAVE A [DARK] THEME SETTING OPTION ADDED SO TH@ I AND ANYONE ELESE WITH A LOW VISION DISABILITY CAN MORE EASILY SEE THE [FONTS] HAS TOTALLY IGNORE AS IF IT WOULD RUIN THEIR dang APP TO DO SO!... Thank you for disabling comments on files again. It is a pleasure using Dropbox again! It's probably a trivial matter to others but really makes a positive difference to someone like me who's registered 'Severely sight impaired'.
But the app pass code is inaccessible with TalkBack TalkBack user can't use it. Please improve.

I began using this app many years ago. Back then you didnt need an apple ID but now it appears I can only get access to my account or speak to someone about that account via chat. I have VISION PROBLEMS so chat does not work well for me. I need to speak with someone via phone but finding a phone or tha lack of ease in finding one is proving to me that DropBox doesn't give a hoot about customers especially those with disabilities.

The latest update seems to have a darker easier to read font. That is great for me because of my visual impairment...thanks for the new font and features. Now if you could add a dark theme..... :) Really thanks much. UPDATE: 4 stars off for not letting me permanently delete files from my phone or linux desktop. You verified my email so whats the issue???

Hearts are really bad for blind people. Although it's an overall easy-to-use app for blind people they tend to do more mistakes simply by mistyping and it makes it impossible to learn. The app should be more fair to everyone. No one likes these hearts anyway..
It is not accessible for a blind because there are unlabeled buttons and graphics in the interface. Please label them.

Handy for learning the very! Basics but now I'm learning advanced basics I'm finding the lack of information and feedback from this app very frustrating and confusing. I'm using this as an alternative to keeping a gaming PC on while learning but this app needs more explanations and the ability to take notes. For goodness sake this app is updated frequently but little to nothing is improved... why not add a simple colour scheme such as blue / pink and grey for word genders with a colour scheme option for colour blind users.

The only thing that bugs me for a while is that I cannot access the lecture notes in the app itsself. I can access them on the website version of duolingo. It would be very nice to add them on the app aswell. It makes it very hard to study without them. Dark mode would be much appreciated aswell. White on white makes me blind after a while...

This app is the mosthelpful of all the language apps I could find. Only thing is that it is not quite accessible for the blind user ousing the BrailleSense Polaris. I can only access a few skills in a course. Have to do the rest with my phone...

This app is a great way to learn a new language. The only issue I have is that it is not intuitive enough for us blind users on Android. If you enjoy Duolingo it's way better on Apple. But other than that I love this app and have learned a lot with it.
I would like that you can improve the application for blind people can use it more easily.

it's not bad for people who are visually impaired so it's it's a good app I would recommend it and basically because I'm visually impaired so it really is not bad for someone who can't see for the blind alright peace out

The app us fine. I personally have trouble using it consistently as I have had cataract surgery and my eyes blur. Would prefer on larger computer. Not my ideal way of learning but it does help a lot with language/accent understanding

I enjoy using duolingo but the recent UI update is not as good as the previous I don't mind keeping the new one but atleast give an option to revert back to the old UI. Also I'm disappointed that there is no NIGHT MODE doesn't make sense not to have one when most of us practice at night also helps reduce eye strain and improve battery life. Please consider night mode!
Would love to see a dark mode to reduce eye strain.

amazing language learning tool. i have never found learning a language so much fun and made this much progress nso quickly. i deducted 1 Star as i woukd suggest addinf a feature to enable users to change the background from white to black or yellow to reduce eye strain when learning. thanks!
Loved it. Helped me with English and now Japanese. It's amazing. A night mode would be really helpful though as it would avoid eye strain and take advantage of my AMOLED screen

I enjoy duolingo. My knowledge in other languages is increasing quickly and efficiently. Also can you guys add a dark theme. Most of the time I work on duolingo in bed in the morning before I do anything else and it's a bit eye straining for me. Thank you
A well designed app to kickstart your language learning. I like the dark mode it prevents eye strain and its there so that you have more learning time!
Its GREAT its FUN well thought out and learn at your own pace. It NOW comes in Dark Mode no more eye strain. YAY!

Wow! Duolingo got 5 star just because of it's new awesome Dark mode feature which is very helpful to reduce eye strain. Ratings described that now the app has a smooth user interface and no lag during reading stories.
Dark mode rules! Thank you for adding this feature. I have light sensitivity and allowing me to change it to dark mode really helps me. I can't believe I'm learning Spanish! Thanks Duolingo!

The recent update did not make it remotely faster in fact everything is slower. The graphical bloatware is ugly and the animations are annoying and everthing lags. The only good thing I can say is that making everything SO MUCH BIGGER would be a good OPTION for people with low vision. If only it were optional. In addition it used to be I could move the banner telling me I got something wrong and see if I made a typo or not speaking of which it no longer seems to recognize obvious typos.
Um tema escuro tornaria o app mais acessível a pessoas com baixa visão. A dark theme would make the app more accessible to low vision people.

Love this app only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that it needs accessibility features. You can't zoom in. It doesnt work well with the access. features on my phone. Can't pinch and zoom. I have 2 low vision children who i wanted to use it to learn chinese....but the characters are really tiny ☹ and it makes me long for stronger reading glasses for myself. But really do love it .makes learning a new language seem fun and not work.
The print is too light for person with low vision. I enjoy the app but I don't always get to see the full sequence

Edit: was awesome & worked great before new update. Horrible design now couldnt care less about color but tiny words really dont help my old eyes. I'd like to see new content before redesigning the app to cater toward eagle-eyed young'uns I've still got a empty bonus slot. What in the world are you developers thinking about changing it in the wrong direction that makes me think PLUS may not be worth it. :(
Good experience but yellow or gold font color is hard on old eyes. Maybe change them or allow user settings
Only wish the text was a little larger. These old eyes have trouble.

I like the modular approach but greater clarity is needed for achievements milestones awards and alternate learning paths. Also when the keyboard is active you can go to the next test by pressing enter. This should be possible at all times including word selection and general navigation like an accessible browser or screen reader.
Thank you for the needed tweaks & polish to the new UX. I ❤️ the stories mode! And the inclusion of a dark mode for those of us with sensitive eyes seals the deal. Excellent app!

Not TalkBack friendly. Easier to use Duolingo on a laptop where I can zoom in.
Doesn't work with Talkback but the web version on PC works amaxingly

I like the lessons but there are lots of unlabeled buttons when using TalkBack so I'm uninstalling

i really love this app. being a person with visual impairment i tried many apps for learning spanish but none were accessible. but this app is... thumbs up for that

Helps a lot to learn new languages right from scratch for people who are eager. Stories streek freezes leader boards really add to the experience. Keep improving and spreading the joy of learning. All in all Good Job :)

Highly recommend this app and think I've learned more using it daily then I ever did in school! Thank you!

Legal yes ethical NO!!! I don't need anything from ebay enough to take this big of a risk of getting screeed by both the vendor and ebay. For my protection I am uninstalling ebay.
AHHHHHHHHH! MY EYES I AM BLIND 😡 why have you made the whole UI white its horrible not to mention blinding

Hope you will consider this and open up the EBAY WORLD to THE BLIND.

easy for someone who is partially sighted

I am a totally blind user and I use my phone and tablet with Android's built in TalkBack screenreading software to navigate my devices and read what's on the screen. My understanding before installing Facebook Lite was that it would work with TalkBack. I was quite frankly disgusted to discover that the app is completely unuseable with TalkBack or other screenreading software for the blind. With Facebook having a dedicated accessibility team there is no excuse whatsoever for this to be the case especially given the fact that both Facebook and Messenger as well as the Messenger Lite app are TalkBack compatible. So why shouldn't Facebook lite be? When I open the app for the first time I was greeted by an unlabelled image that TalkBack won't read again making it completely unuseable. Great if it uses less data/storage but alas tough luck for TalkBack users. Facebook I'm very disappointed I would have expected better from you guys. Please make this TalkBack friendly!

The Fitbit Charge 3 App is really not very good at all! I have had my fitbit for less than a month and already I am having difficulties syncing the app. I have eye sight problems therefore rely on the app to review my data. However now I have to rely on family to read it from my watch. Needless to say the failure of the app has reined my experience with my fitbit and I am overall very disappointed.

I want to be able to monitor my heart rate steps and calories burned. I DON'T want a 'Dick Tracy' communication device. 😤 I want better access through the app dashboard. I DON'T want to navigate on the 1 inch screen of the device ESPECIALLY since I have vision issues. AND I have reset 'screen brightness' to NORMAL so I can ACTUALLY SEE but device resets to 'dim' on it's own! How can I set brightness level PERMANENTLY??

The font is very small and light and impossible for me to read outdoors. Update 1/29/20. Would be GREAT if Fitbit would add a dark mode. But that doesn't matter anyway because I have gone back to the old version. I am hoping the old version will not be discontinued. If so I may be looking for a new tracker. That is really sad because I have been a fitbit user since 2014 and I really do like it. I just purchased a new Charge 2 which I received just 3 days ago. I really do like it. review_text: I really enjoy creating a magazine that talks about everyday life of being visually impaired and blind people. I myself by being visually impaired and I had graduated from the Overbrook School for the Blind 1979 in Philadelphia.. By me creating this magazine will let people know what it is like seeing through the eyes of the blind through my pictures. I also have a question about how to remove old photos from photos of you? Thank you very much.

app_name: Flipboard - Latest News- Top Stories & Lifestyle
review_text: I enjoy using this app but can only use it for a short duration each time. Why? That bright white screen is annoying and eyes start to hurt after 5 minutes. Please install a Dark Mode. Many phones own ship with screen tech that benefit from dark mode operations. Battery life is superior and user experience is enhanced. Flipboard is a wonderful concept and can replace many news apps and websites as the one and only news source. The problem is that with a glaring white background one can not use Flipboard long term without suffering eye strain. Implementation of a dark mode solves this problem and improves the user experience tenfold.

I have one problem with this keyboard. I am a talkback user and for faster typing I use a Bluetooth keyboard. when I am in my editing field for writing a WhatsApp message or when I write an SMS or I write a post on Facebook the Talkback will say 'showing English South Africa keyboard'. That's fine. My problem is when I navigate with my Bluetooth keyboard to 'send' the Talkback or keyboard or something keeps taking me to a 'password keyboard'. The Talkback doesn't tell me the 'send' option as it should. Secondly when I compose an e-mail and I am at the fields where I type in the address subject and the e-mail the Talkback or the Gboard or something keeps saying 'help to make Gboard a better keyboard'. I'll happily change my review to something much better but not until Google fixes a major flaw you purposely created. I'm visually impaired and as a result I rely on audible notifications. A few months ago I noticed that I was no longer hearing the sound notification when activating the voice search by saying 'OK Google'. Instead my phone vibrates which is barely noticeable. I spent a couple of weeks trying to bring the sound back to no avail. (And no my volume is not turned down or muted in any way on any level.) To my surprise I found that hundreds of thousands of people are having the same issue. And all because Google decided to 'beta test' doing away with just that sound notification WITHOUT EVEN TELLING ANYONE THEY'RE DOING IT!!! (And no... I'm NOT part of the beta testing program!) Google you didn't even give anyone a chance to opt out or put an option in settings to turn it on or off!! So until the sound notification is back by update or an option to turn it on and off in settings is introduced I'll keep your rating at 1 star. I find it disgusting and unacceptable that Google would blatantly ignore their customer's needs and wants just to 'test' such a simple thing. Especially when people like myself depend on it. I'm so disappointed that I'm seriously considering switching to using Apple devices exclusively... and I despise Apple! At least Siri is reliable and doesn't discriminate against the disabled. FIX THIS PROBLEM YESTERDAY ALREADY GOOGLE! Otherwise you're going to lose a ton of business to your main competition! 😠😡😤

I absolutely love Google Maps on Android but as someone with colorblindness the traffic colors are impossible to interpret and they seem to get worse with each release. This seems like a easy fix: allow for some user control over the traffic display color scheme patterns line width etc. Do that and this is a five star app.

When an update finally made the green and red traffic overlays different brightness levels I was happy. I could finally see the difference between green and red without asking another person's assistance. Feature request: a Google Labs toggle for color blindness support. I liked the pastel green traffic overlay because I could finally tell the difference. By the way 'bug fixes' is not a good description for the update if you do more than fix bugs.
Green-red is the most common form of color blindness and yet the traffic lines ignore this in their congestion color spectrum..
Needs to have a traffic option for red/green color blindness. Right now good and bad traffic look the same. Perhaps a color picker.
PLEASE offer a color blindness mode for traffic. A pattern instead of yellow/green/red would be greatly appreciated!
Needs a differentiation between traffic routes & satellite image similar to the previous versions. 60% of us are color-blind.

I am legally blind own a guide dog and live in Los Angeles. Google Maps has proven to be an invaluable resource for us to navigate around the city. Because of my eye disease I can only 'see' the map on my phone or tablet if I hold it an inch away from my face but I am able to pick out bus routes and subways zoom in using satellite view and locate places that I've never been to simply by using street view. (It's as if I already went there in Virtual 3D before I even step out the door) I am able to find out which streets have sidewalks and where there are intersections with stop lights. Thank you so much Google Maps!!!

keyword_found: low vision, talk back, visually impaired
review_text: I am visually impaired and I bought a Google pixel XL phone. I have low vision so I don't use talk back but I leave text to speech on if I need something read out loud. To my surprise it is impossible to get your new (supposedly smart) assistant to do a simple task: all I ask is: 'read me what's on the screen' she doesn't have that capability yet (really?!?). I understand developers might not add that option on their apps but your Google stand and book apps should have it. I have to turn talk back on!
I love the newsfeed I just can't for the life of me figure out why you cannot zoom in on the page for us with old eyes makes no sense. if not for that problem I would have given it five stars

I get shown articles from Dorset when I live in Scotland.

app_name: Life360: Family Locator & GPS Tracker for Safety
review_text: As a severely visually impaired user this app was used several times a day by me to 'check in' that I had arrived to my places of work etc. Now that the one touch 'check in' feature has been removed and colour scheme changed it is impossible for me to use. Also drains battery and constantly says not connected even when using wifi or full 3G/4G which leaves me in further danger of not being able to contact my family. This app used to be the most used on my phone. Now I no longer trust it. UNINSTALLING!

app_name: Life360: Family Locator & GPS Tracker for Safety
review_text: We need high contrast menus available for the visually impaired. My son can't read his app because he can't see it. He's keeping it because of me but could you work on that? Thanks!
I am blind person and using this app with TalkBack so please make fully accessible this app with TalkBack thank you very much
Hi I am from blind lead trust organization this apps not accessable for the visually impaired
It's not accessible for TalkBack accessibility to upload videos in this App it's very difficult for visually impaired people' challenge.
Please make a night mode on line today to reduce eyestrain. Thank you
We love Line. Is spreading in Costa Rica!!! Can you add an option to enlarge the size of font?? For my older low vision parents?
Want more accessible with talkback
The only app in my phone WITHOUT a DARK MODE 🥵. I wonder why LinkedIn is lagging behind in updates. The current theme is making me blind !!!! 🤢🤧🤕
Implement dark mode already 😤 Is it really that difficult to implement or are you having plans to blind our eyes 😭

Dear LinkedIn Product Manager - It's been ages when would we be getting a dark mode? My eyes are hurting seeing all the light. Please for heaven's sake prioritise your backlog. Cannot bear this for long now I am going blind and you know that when a blind man cries lord you know there ain't no sadder tale.
I love the app but as a humble request please put dark mode I have a eye defect 🙏🙏🙏
Sir Please provide DARK MODE. It will save our eyes from damage and make this app eye strain free.
Occasional glitches and the absence of dark mode make me reluctant to using the Android app. The web app is much more responsive and I use a Dark Mode plugin to reduce eye strain on the web app.

Great service that has helped me over the years and more recently with taking LinkedIn learning courses and having access to other premium features! The only thing I wish the app had is the capability of transitioning to or toggling a 'night-mode' option so I can continue to search in the evenings/at night without additional eye strain (using the blue light filter and general night settings on my S10+ is still no match for all of the white space that occupies the screen.) Still great resource!
Decent app. Gets the job done. I wish I could change the theme of the app to dark/black backgrounds to help with eye strain.

For those with low vision the update is a total disaster. little print format of postings is hard to read pm's written to others no longer have blue background contrast. this is key for those of us with low vision. Not happy with this. Doubt Ill be on LI but so much longer. A real shame..messed up a once great program w/ the ' update.'
Pretty good enlargement not allowed so what about LOW VISION people?
The app made it easy for me with low vision.

1-screen viewing so pale and weak old eyes find it difficult to read and tiring. 2- the ad is an in my face ad which constantly interupted what I am doing which results in m getting pissed off with LinkedIn and going to an alternative site. Way to go guys great marketing.
The buttons are not properly labeled and so it is difficult to use the app with TalkBack. Pretty poor for a top developer that they can't meet basic accessibility standards.

Turning TalkBack off and on This app does not work well with tackback. Everything I open or close talkback it resets the state of the app preventing me from navigating without talkback and reading text with talkback

New security feature is a pile of rubbish. Does not work for visually challenged people and then it goes into a non ending loop. Absolutely rubbish. Unusable and a waste of time. Uninstall and use web browser

It sucks i cant get a damn ride. 3 times i tried to get a ride. I guess i walk on these dangerus roads concidering im legally blind :(. Please get drivers or get a damn driverless car when no human is around to do the job

I love the lift service. however as a blind user using TalkBack to navigate the app I am having significant issues with accessing features of the app. I have been trying for a week now to pass this information along to Lyft and discuss this with them and I've gotten nowhere. hopefully some app developer will read this and contact me. I would love to give this app a five-star rating.

For blind users who use TalkBack many buttons need text labels so that we know what the buttons do. The rating slider also needs to be labeled as such as I gave drivers who deserved 5 star ratings below average ratings before figuring this out. Service is great your app needs work.

When booking a ride was left it simply says GPS location but doesn't inform the screen reader user what the address is that Lyft has as your current GPS location which means I have to put in where I am all the time as opposed to being able to rely on the GPS location if it's correct.

Okay! Seriously did these people ever have someone that uses talkback test this app out? The reason this app doesn't deserve a better than a 3 star rating is for the lack of properly labeled butons and controls for talk back users. The developers need to label these controls and buttons properly. If you are a android user and you use talkback and install this app. I seriously encourage you to e-mail the developer and really push them to fix this interface.

I am a visually impaired person. This app needs a night mode toggle button. The bright color and white background prevent me from using the app.

0 I am visually impaired. Try to order a car multiple times just got a map of the world. There is no one to assist me with the app no one to call and no way to get a ride from Lyft. I have used the app extensively during the pandemic but today I was put at risk because I could not get a car.

I find lift to be a very useful app and the price they give you is the price that you pay the only problem I had was a Lyft driver dropped me off at a different location From the address that I put in the app for my drop off location Which I'm sure this would not be a problem for most people but I am visually impaired therefore I was lost I was not where I was supposed to be it was not familiar please it was evening I ended up trying to get in the middle the street to stop cars to get help

The app is not fully accessible for visually impaired in Android system I talked to the tech support of Lyft several times regarding this issue but nobody took care of it. I really don't like the customer support of Lyft or who makes this app.

If there was one thing I would like it would be do have more drivers on the road because at certain times in certain areas a does kind of take long to get a ride if any and I know that's not really the fault of the application. Other than that it works well so far

I can no longer enable dark mode UNLESS I use the stock theme which is garbage and incredibly boring. This never happened prior. I think it happened after a system update but the developers need to provide an update lest I have to 1. Use a theme I don't want 2. Have to deal with eye strain (no thank you) or 3. Just uninstall this app and steer others away from it.
Convient minimalistic but with a terrible eye straining color palette
It's ok as simple SMS app but I miss a dark theme to avoid eye strain.

Plus having a black or dark mode available would help many devices with AMOLED screens. Everything else is spot on perfect. Additionally upon this recent update for my LG V20 2.9.051 (Tuba_RC11_xxxhdpi.arm64-v8a.phone) Enhanced Features is missing in the Advanced section in Settings within Android Messages. I can uninstall the update then it's back and I can use it again. IDK what is causing it.

Also it allows me to view messages in my BlackBerry Hub where I can see my emails and text messages in one place for quick access so you can catch those texts you may have missed.
I like being able to use on web browser too. Dark themes great on reducing my eye strain.
Great app especially black background reduces eye strain also opening messages in your PC browser is also a great feature. Overall best

Was it absolutely necessary that this crucial feature be eliminated? What of older people that cannot discern small font but would rather identify by color THEY CHOOSE instead of enlarging the font to ridiculous sizes. This was a stupid short sighted move. Bring it back.
Fantastic I'm short sighted would like free large keyboard I am 67 no Internet at home only got my phone

Messages are clear n easy to readI am sight impaired n it's great for me!

Works fine. There are some major things that Google should address though. First off the largest font size is NOT accommodating for people with eyesight problems Discord gets close if a point of reference is needed. Also the swipe-to-archive and swipe-to-delete functions need either off switches or to be removed altogether in favor of a long press on the convo to show a menu it is WAY too easy for us to accidentally swipe our convos out of sight or even out of existence.

Update 2: They brought back the old ui which while functional is really awkward to use. I hate it. Bring back the one that is similar to the full scale pc version. Or make it an option for people who don't like the current ui. I'm taking off two stars for this. Quick update: Microsoft changed the ui with the latest update and it looks like the pc application and I'm loving it. Thanks Microsoft. Its much better than the previous ui. Also as a suggestion add a dark mode/theme to reduce battery usage eyestrain and an easy way to implement it would be to reverse the blacks and whites. Just a suggestion. Also add a way to set a few default options like page layout font font size etc. And add a recovery/repair option to the app to repair the file in case something goes wrong. Old review for an older version: The app is fine but sometimes the blinker teleports out of its spot and to another line or paragraph entirely. Some words vanish some lines automatically appear. Some words don't delete or delete other words entirely from another line. Sometimes when I paste text it doesn't stay like to should. For example if I paste bold text in a larger font from another part of the document somewhere it appears as plain text. Something italic reverts back to plain text. From the same document. This is really annoying. I have to close and restart the app to fix the problem and this usually isn't that big of a problem for me but when it take over 15-30 seconds to fully load a medium sized file (120 pages) to a large file (200+ pages) it makes me waste a lot of time. As a writer a college going student and other stuff my time is precious. And the thing is since it is a docx file I can't open it in anything other than my phone cause I don't have a laptop or computer anymore. I used to type on my computer but since having accidentally fried it this app has been my sole way of continuing with my work. Please Microsoft fix this.
The app does a great job at fulfilling its intended purpose. How about adding a 'night mode' feature to reduce eyestrain?
The initial display doesn't fit to screen. Ok I have low-vision and my text size is large but the program should be flexible to medium and large text displays.

I am visually impaired and use the TalkBack screenreader to interact with my Android device. I was really disappointed to see that Word is not very accessible with TalkBack. Though TalkBack reads all of the menu items and buttons for formatting there is no way for me to get to the edit field where I can type text into my document. Also TalkBack won't read documents imported from other sources. For this reason I have no choice but to give it a 1 star rating. Please make Word more TalkBack user-friendly!!!
I absolutely hate it because there's no dark mode so basically useless for me due to sensitive eyes.

As always Microsoft has delivered a solid brilliant application for its users. But there are a couple of things that are missing or unknown to me. That's why it got 4-stars. First there's no 'dark-view screen mode' or page background color selection options. These options are necessary due to my light sensitive eyes. Second there's no security-code protection available for opening particular documents. To get around these weaknesses I was forced to create documents in another app that supposed these options then open them using Word it worked! I then used those docs as a template for creating new docs!
I use it a lot for my assignments and because I have a sight impairment I find (word) helpful with its many useful features.

review_text: Works great with full screen view and zoom control. Clear and easy to use. The freeze control is a brilliant idea. You can see your face better when you don't have to hold the phone in one place while trying to see a hard to see angle. Saves eye strain.

app_name: Mirror Plus: Mirror with Light for Makeup & Beauty
review_text: Works great with full screen view and zoom control. Clear and easy to use. The freeze control is a brilliant idea. You can see your face better when you don't have to hold the phone in one place while trying to see a hard to see angle. Saves eye strain.

review_text: Sometimes it shows one line with no option for selecting the opposite bound direction. And that tixx me off. app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: I'm partially sighted and it means now I don't miss my stops. Also I can .let my family know when I will get home so my dinner can be ready on time .and so my husband is not late for his night shifts. I am sharing the love. .Moovit is fabulous!

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: This is a very useful app in general however it is not programmed to be accessible for those who use screen readers. It is very difficult to use this app while using a screen reader.

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: I have found the app very useful as a Severely Sight Impaired traveller. I gave found it to be accurate for my commutes in and around my home town and across the North West. I have even been able to rely on the app in other regions of the country when wanting to use buses and trains.

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: I'm seriously sight impaired but I love to get out and about. This app gives me confidence I can get home again.

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: It's a very good idea. Adding TalkBack is good thought. Guys please collaborate with Google now card. Then you guys will be in reach to the customers.

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: This is a nice free app with good public transit info. I am visually impaired and I was hoping this could replace the transit navigation you use to be able to do with Google maps. There is however no voice navigation directions for me to hear over blue tooth . It will not redirect you if you take a wrong turn. They are basically static navigation directions. It does sound a tone when you are near your stop. It is a nice product but as far as guiding me every step of the way as it states I do not quite see it that way

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: Pinch zoom for us visually impaired :) WD though.

app_name: Moovit: All Local Transit & Mobility Options
review_text: Being visually impaired this app is a godsend I can travel on bus routes I'm unfamiliar with alone. No more spending a journey panicking I'm on the wrong bus or will get off at the wrong place and no more relying on drivers (who often forget) to tell me when to get off. To me this app is independence I absolutely love it! Now if only I could remember to use it while waiting for a bus I could avoid flagging down the wrong bus :-)

I am very pleased with the Netflix app with the exception of two things: (1) While viewing a movie on my Samsung Galaxy Proclaim the lights for the four buttons at the bottom of the phone (menu home back and search) do not turn off. This makes for a major eye strain while trying to enjoy the video. (2) If I pause the video to check a new notification that came through on my phone I have to click 'Resume' and reload the video when I switch back to Netflix. I'd rather it stayed loaded and I could simply press play to resume. That being said I truly treasure this app especially when I am stuck waiting somewhere like in the car while a family member goes into a store or when I'm in line and while I'm in bed and not quite ready to fall asleep. Thanks Netflix!
